text: i worry about the future what will life
be like when i grow up human activities
are accelerating climate change which
could have severe effects across earth
but my dad works at bp one of the
world's top greenhouse gas emitters does
this mean he doesn't care about my
future does this mean by default but i
don't care about the planet my name is
stephanie i'm 13 years old and this is
my environmental dilemma
[Music]
it's always an interesting conversation
at home dad can you explain what bp does
and what your job is we work to produce
you know oil and gas you know we refine
it we distribute it so i work in
procurement in supply chain which means
you know buying things bp emitted about
374 million tonnes of carbon dioxide
equivalent last year from its oil fields
to its clients car exhaust do you feel
guilty working within the oil industry i
don't you know feel guilty if i chose to
leave you know somebody else would you
know take my job there's still a demand
for oil and gas that brings heat light
and energy whether we like it or not
it's still an important part of the vast
majority of ours you know day-to-day
life what we need to be focused on is
how we solve the problem i have
questioned whether i should go and work
for a green company i could work in
wind or solar however to me that almost
feels like walking away from the problem
rather than
staying to fix it when my friends ask
what you do sometimes i don't know if i
should tell them you work in the oil
industry how does that make you feel it
does make me feel sad that you you know
that that i put you in that position i
understand why your friends or your
generation feel like that as well what
these industries is going to need is
people like yourself and your friends to

improved
and then ultimately we do get to a net
zero for oil and gas industry provides
75 of energy needs within the uk as well

we
consume energy our electricity much much
of that is produced by burning fossil
fuels fossil fuel companies are are
currently
a very very large contributor to
greenhouse gas emissions greenhouse
gases that we keep pumping into our
atmosphere by burning fossil fuels
predominantly they make our planet
hotter create extreme weather events and
the impact on human life is radical and
potentially irreversible bp is pledging
to become a net zero company by 2050 by
generating energy in more sustainable
ways is that enough are they going to
stop selling fossil fuels altogether by
no they aren't net zero is only good as
the absolute absence of fossil fuels and
bp
is not there so no it is not enough what
would you say my dad needs to do about
the climate situation there are no
humans that are working for uh fossil
fuel companies and bp included that wake
up in the morning and say today i'm
going to destroy the climate and i'm
certain about your dad because he raised

you ask and about your interest i am
certain that the thing that he wants
most for you and for all of us is a safe
and healthy world so it's really about
getting everyone supported
through this really difficult transition
kind of address it from multiple angles
not just from the
no more oil means that we fire all the
world workers but it's actually about
taking care of everyone because that is
part of a sustainable future bp is
pledging to become a net zero company by
2050 when i'll be 42 years old the
strategy involves generating energy in

decarbonize too but bp said oil and gas
will remain part of the energy mix for
decades
i believe i can have a bigger impact
doing what i'm doing now rather than
going to a company that is already green
i like to think my dad could be part of
